metadata.title: CASE 374/03: Allegations of Misconduct in the Post-Conflict Assessment Unit
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Office of Internal Oversight Services

overview: This document is an investigation report on alleged misconduct in the Post-Conflict Assessment Unit of UNEP, focusing on conflict of interest, kickbacks, and improper representation of UNEP in various seminars by staff members.

applicable_laws.excerpt: United Nations Financial Procurement Regulation 1.2 states that 'Procurement functions include all actions necessary for the acquisition, by purchase or lease, of products and services with principles such as best value for money, fairness, integrity, transparency, and effective international competition.'
Consultants shall not perform functions of staff members of the Organization or have any representative or supervisory responsibility.

background.context: The Office of Internal Oversight Services received reports of alleged misconduct involving UNEP staff and consultants in the Balkans Task Force and the Post-Conflict Assessment Unit.
timeline: 2000-05: UNEP Staff Member 2 received an appointment with PCAU

allegations.description: UNEP Staff Member 1 and UNEP Staff Member 2 maintained an ongoing relationship with their former company while working for the BTF and PCAU, suggesting a conflict of interest.
allegations.findings: No conflict of interest was established although the appearance of one existed.

allegations.description: UNEP Staff Member 1 demanded a kickback of fifty percent of consultancy fees paid to experts, shared with UNEP Staff Member 2 and UNEP/PCAU Consultant.
allegations.findings: There was insufficient evidence to support this allegation.

allegations.description: UNEP Staff Member 1 and UNEP Staff Member 2 received high-level contracts without meeting proper educational and professional qualifications.
allegations.findings: The contracts were justified by UNEP management based on performance. This allegation could not be substantiated.

allegations.description: UNEP Staff Member 1 and UNEP/PCAU Consultant represented UNEP in seminars and supervised staff members, contrary to UN rules.
allegations.findings: This allegation was substantiated as a breach of UN regulations.

findings: UNEP and UNOPS deviated from United Nations rules and regulations due to operational urgency. However, the issues should have been addressed once stability was achieved.

violations.excerpt: Consultants shall not perform functions of staff members or have representative responsibilities.
Procurement Regulation 1.2 was violated with contracts awarded without competitive bidding, affecting fairness and transparency.
